content:
I don't know your location. however, you can find out which native plants are best for pollinators in your area by contacting your local conservation organization, native plant nursery or extension office. they will have information about the best native plants that support pollinators in your specific climate and region.

however, here are a few native plants that are known to attract pollinators in many regions:

1. goldenrod: a late-season bloomer and a favorite of many different kinds of bees.

2. coneflower: the vibrant blooms attract a variety of bees and butterflies.

3. black-eyed susan: these flowers will attract multiple butterfly species, bees and other common pollinators.

4. milkweed: the flowers of milkweed are a vital source of nectar for monarch butterflies.

remember, when planting for pollinators, choosing a variety of native plants that bloom throughout the season will provide a more diverse and continuous food source for pollinators.
